TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WS2007HttpBinding extends System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding

Docs.summary: Represents an interoperable binding that derives from and provides support for the updated versions of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security%2A>, , and <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBindingBase.TransactionFlow%2A> binding elements.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WS2007HttpBinding class adds a system-provided binding similar to <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> but uses the Organization for the Advancement of Structured Information Standards (OASIS) standard versions of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ReliableSession>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding.Security%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBindingBase.TransactionFlow%2A> protocols. No changes to the object model or default settings are required when using this binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor initializes an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WS2007HttpBinding> class and sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.ReliableMessagingVersion>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol> properties that specify the WS-Security 1.1, WS-Trust 1.3, WS-SecureConversation 1.3, WS-SecurityPolicy 1.2, and WS-I Basic Security Profile 1.0 security protocols.
## Examples The following example shows how to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WS2007HttpBinding> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode securityMode) cil managed

Docs.param: The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified type of security used by the binding.

remarks.format: ## Examples The following example shows how to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WS2007HttpBinding> class with a `securityMode` parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string configName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a binding specified by its configuration name.
Docs.exception: The binding element with the name was not found.

Docs.param: The value of <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> that specifies the type of security that is used with the SOAP message and for the client.
if a reliable session is enabled; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified type of security used by the binding and a value that indicates whether a reliable session is enabled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes an instance of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WS2007HttpBinding> class and sets the <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.ReliableMessagingVersion>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol> properties that specify the WS-Security 1.1, WS-Trust 1.3, WS-SecureConversation 1.3, WS-SecurityPolicy 1.2, and WS-I Basic Security Profile 1.0 security protocols.
